alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Indian River; Inland Martin; Inland Southern Brevard; Inland St. Lucie; Mainland Southern Brevard; Okeechobee; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 4:46PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. Lucie, southeastern Okeechobee, Indian River, Martin and southeastern Brevard Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 446 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from West Melbourne to 9 miles southwest of Pointe West to 6 miles west of J And S Fish Camp. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Port Saint Lucie, Palm Bay, Melbourne, Jupiter, and Walton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
